bio:
Sitting in your pocket, on your screen, and in your home, one monolithic brand listens in, makes “suggestions,” and subconsciously informs the world around you. It lies in the background only to entirely shape the foreground. Sound familiar? 

We needn’t cite any real-life names as we know they’re probably listening, but this idea remains the crux of Zuli Jr.’s Stop It God., due May ’21. In his case, Daisy serves as the ever-present corporate overlord with a HAL 9000-style computer to navigate daily life. Crafting a story of his own, the New York singer, songwriter, and alternative R&B insurgent opens up a worm hole between future-facing pop, Platonic allegory, science fiction, and eerily parallel truths.

releases.releaseDescription:
The first single from Zuli Jr.'s sophomore album - 'Stop it God.'. Sunny production and a steady beat strut underneath his dynamic vocal performance, fluttering from intimate verses into fiery falsetto.

"How to Feel is about examining the ego from the outside looking in and how that affects the people around you. This is easily one of my favorite songs on the record and feels like the perfect transition from one chapter to the next.” - Zuli

'Stop it God.', the second full-length album by Zuli Jr., is an allegory of the self. The version we stare at day after day in the mirror vs. the version we upload online. A reflection on the creative being within us all, and the modern world that leads us to believe we are at the center of it.  Addressing the pain and confusion of this reality, Zuli touches on the spectrum of what we put our faith into, and how we choose to cope and find meaning in our lives. Ultimately, Stop it God. plays as a deliberate statement on the human condition, yet open-ended and up for interpretation.

Blue Sky is the second single from Zuli Jr.'s forthcoming sophomore album Stop it God. out May 14th. The song blends futuristic indie-pop with soulful vocals and chronicles a breaking point for Zuli, who "[I] realized I can’t be anything other than myself—and that’s not always going to sound the same”.

Zuli Jr. is back with Two as the third single from his sophomore album Stop it God. out May 14th. The indie r&b/pop singer-songwriter documents a broken heart and soul, as Zuli proclaims, “pause the world and never resume, hold me whole I’ve broken into two”.

Her Manner is an ode to romanticizing addiction. Learning to break the cycle and address issues rather than to perpetually seek out pleasure. The final preview ahead of Zuli Jr.’s new album Stop it God.
